document_data.mainbody:
Baran al-Amin al-Jinn was a janni who lived in Al-Yabki Mountains in Zakhara in 1367 DR.
As a priest of Kor, Baran donned the robes of a qadi and began acting as a judge at a sacred site in the mountains near TurabThe references states "...at a sacred site between Talab and Sikak..." but Talab is located on the opposite side of the Golden Gulf hundreds of miles away, so I made an educated guess and swapped the town with Turab instead ... which is near Sikak. and Sikak. He was popular among Al-Badia, many of whom traveled considerable distances to discuss their problems with him.
